title.narrative: Agua Tuya_Bolivian Descentralized Sanitation Models Program
Agua Tuya – decentraliserade modeller för vattenrening i Bolivia

description.narrative: The aim of the program is to promote decentralized ecological and economically efficient sanitation models (in urban areas and cities between 2,000 and 10,000 inhabitants) with a focus on waste water plants that will allow: i) the closing of the water cycle ii) the replication of those models in different ecological contexts iii) the scaling up of the models at national level

Programmet syftar till att utveckla och främja ekonomiskt och ekologiskt effektiva decentraliserade sanitetsmodeller för urbana och peri urbana områden med 2000- 10 000 invånare. Insatsen fokuserar på uppförandet av vattenreningsverk som tillåter: -att sluta vattencykeln och ta vara på näringsämnen -replikering av dessa modeller inom olika ekologiska sammanhang geografiska och ekonomiska kontexter -en uppskalning av modellerna på nationell nivå
De viktigaste resultaten som programmet skall uppnå under hela programstödet är; -återanvändning av vatten och avfallshantering (näringsämnen) -en förbättring av institutionella förhållanden hos lokala organisationer som ger sanitetsservice -implementering av hållbar sanitetsservice på projektplatser/anläggningar -utveckling av normer och riktlinjer på nationell nivå -utveckling av finansiell service som kan bidra till en uppskalning av dessa modeller
Den nationella organisationen Agua Tuya är föreslagen som ambassadens avtalspart och huvudpart i implementeringen av programmet. Agua Tuya kommer att arbeta i främst sex områden: Cliza, Tolata, Tarija, Santiago de Huata och Montero för att uppnå ovan nämnda resultat. För utveckling av finansiella tjänster som kan bidra till ekonomisk hållbarhet och uppskalning av sanitetsmodellerna kommer Agua Tuya att arbeta med en nationell finansieringsinstitution.

The aim of the program is to promote decentralized ecological and economically efficient sanitation models (in urban areas and cities between 2,000 and 10,000 inhabitants) with a focus on waste water plants that will allow: i) the closing of the water cycle ii) the replication of those models in different ecological contexts iii) the scaling up of the models at national level
The main results that the program must achieve during the whole contribution are: - the reuse of water and solid waste (as nutrients) - the enhancing of institutional conditions in local organizations that provide sanitation services - the implementation of sustainable sanitation services in project sites (Cliza, Punata, Tolata, Tarija, Santiago de Huata, Montero) - the development of norms and guidelines at the national level - the development of financial services that can contribute to the scaling up of these models

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
The main results achieved per effect so far are as follows: Effect 1: Closing the Water Cycle and Nutrient Recovery
San Andrés Waste water treatment plant “WWTP” -Tarija: The start-up of the plant is completed, including the monitoring to measure efficiencies and quality of the treated water. The staff has been trained on operation and maintenance (O&M) and the management model has been established jointly with the community of San Andres and Tarija´s Municipality.
Uriondo WWTP – Tarija: The reactors and the hydraulic equipment have been installed and the wetlands constructed. The official commissioning took place on December 2020.
Surumi WWTP – Cliza: The perimeter fence and wetlands are concluded. The reactors and the sedimentation tank have been installed and the civil works for the pre-treatment channel already finished. The official commissioning took place on December 2020
Fecal Sludge Treatment Plant – Cliza: The production and application of the second batch of eco fertilizer took place in the second semester of 2020. It was applied to corn and potato crops in the Valle Alto region. The initial results showed an improvement of the land, but it is very likely that additional processes shall be needed to comply as an Eco-fertilizer.
Montero WWTP - Santa Cruz: The pre treatment has been concluded with the electrical installation. The WWTP has been commissioned in December 2020
Reuse of treated wastewater in Punata-Cliza-Tolata: The pretreatment process has been improved for the Villa El Carmen WWTP. This will improve the quality of the treated water and its reuse in agriculture.
Retamas-Ucureña WWTP – Cliza: The 4 reactors have been concluded and installed including land leveling works, by-pass, pumping station rehabilitation and external piping. It is expected that it will be delivered by the end of the second semester 2021.
Regarding the activities with La Paz water and sanitation utility “EPSAS”, the framework agreement has already been signed and the equipment of the urine plant purchased. It is expected to deliver the plant by the end of 2021.
Effect 2: Capacity Development and Technical Assistance Regarding the second effect focused on the development of favorable conditions for the development of local institutions and organizations that provide sanitation services, the main activities have been oriented to: 1.-Latin American Chapter Susana Chapter: Preparation and publication of the second SuSanA Newsletter (https://www.susana.org/en/knowledge-hub/regional-chapters/latinoamerica-chapter ), 2- Production of SuSanA promotional spots: Tutorial for web browsing: i) https://youtu.be/bx0pazzSgTg ii) Municipal technician https://youtu.be/ObCkWsqSXEI; iii) Sanitation consultant iv) https://youtu.be/93KsY5pM6HI Student https://youtu.be/e6-qhFJA-RI 3.- Systematization of 3 Latin American experiences of Sludge Management 4.- Development and evaluation of a pilot plant based on Rotating Biological Contactors (CBR) with the UPB University 5.- Institutional support to the Ministry of Water for the updating and completion of the National Strategy for Wastewater Treatment (ENTAR)
Effect 3: Development of Service Integral Management (sustainability of the models)
In San Andrés WWTP -Tarija the management model for the plant has been established with an analysis and study of actual operating costs. Also, a strategy to expand the coverage of the sanitary sewerage system in the San Andres community has been elaborated along with a technical cadaster of the water and sewerage systems.
In Uriondo and Surumi WWTPs preliminary activities for the proposal of the management model have been held with both communities and the technical cadasters concluded. Regarding the Colque Rancho and Montero WWTPs, analysis and study of the real costs of operation have been done. Finally, operation and maintenance tools and guidelines have been elaborated for Villa El Carmen and Tolata WWTPs.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
